Posts.Content: Jan 2, 2008 08:15AM Mamasj wrote: A month isn't a long time to wait. I had my lumpecomy in may of 06, re-excission in june of 06, a port placement in july and started chemo the end of july. I agree to go to a breast surgeon. I'm sorry she had to join this group, but you couldn't of come to a better place. May God Bless Sue
Posts.Title: too long to wait? re-excision after lumpectomy jessicae10 librarychick64

Posts.Content: Oct 9, 2007 06:45AM - edited Oct 9, 2007 06:45AM by Mamasj I did 4dd AC, 4dd Taxol and 14 herceptin tx's. I wanted to quit after my 3rd AC. I was in the hospital twice with infections, due to my blood counts. I felt just horible when I was on AC. I would get my treatments every 2 weeks, so I would only have maybe 4 days that I would feel human.Â  I made it through with the support of my husband and once I was on Taxol, it was a breeze. Try to hang in there if you can. May God Bless Sue
Posts.Title: Chemo-side effects joy89 Indigoblue
Chemo brings early menopause??? Saturn46 ravdeb

Posts.Content: Jan 26, 2008 08:30AM Mamasj wrote: My arm stayed numb for about a month after the axillary node removal. I had a lumpectomy along with it in May 2006. The back side of my left arm is still a little numb. My surgeon told me to stand by a wall, and with your fingers, walk up the wall 3-4 times a day. abelieve it or not, it really did help. May God Bless Sue
Posts.Title: Right arm numb - I'm so depressed MK5233 snowyday
questions for those done w/chemo bluewillow karen1956

Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2007 03:38PM Mamasj wrote: My husband went with me for the first 2 tx's, but after that I would drive myself. Even when I was on Taxol, I drove myself. It made me feel special that my husband was so involved with everything. Do what feels right in your heart. May God Bless Sue

Posts.Content: Sep 21, 2007 07:14AM Mamasj wrote: You both are in my prayers. I was in the hospital twice when I was on AC for infections in my lungs. The first time my blood counts bottomed out and the second time they were extreemly high. Is she on anything for her blood counts? My husband knows where you are at right now with worry. May God Bless Sue

Posts.Content: Sep 13, 2007 03:51PM Mamasj wrote: I did 4dd AC, 4dd Taxol and 14 Herceptin. I finished everything on 7/02/07. I can tell, each day, that I'm getting more and more like my oldself. I still have a few days that my energy level sucks. I look at it, I made it thru a rough year and a half and it has shown me that I am strong. Take each day, one day at a time. May God Bless Sue Dx 4/26/06, IDC, Stage III, Grade III 2/16 nodes, ER-/PR- HER+

Posts.Content: Oct 4, 2007 07:08AM Mamasj wrote: Where is everyone? Doing good here. I had my first normal mammo, in Aug. My first one I had in Feb, came back abnormal. My hair is about 4" now and still very curly. When it's humid, it looks like I've had a really tight perm. When is this mop of hair going to settle down? I hope everyone is doing fine!! May God Bless Sue
Posts.Title: Is Anyone Starting Chemo In Aug 06 Mamasj cheryl66

Posts.Content: Dec 21, 2007 07:46AM Mamasj wrote: Merry Christmas to all! Last year at this time, I still had to wear my wig for Christmas. This year I have a full head of curls. I'm finally getting my port removed on 1/23/08 and I can't wait!! Does it hurt as much after they take it out, as it did after they put it in? All of my tests have come back Great!!! It is true, what a difference one year makes. Everyone have a safe and Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year! May God Bless Sue

Sue IDC er &pr- her2+ 2out of 16 nodes Stage3 Grade2 3.2cm Dx 4/28/2006, IDC, 3cm, Stage IIIA, Grade 3, 2/16 nodes, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2+ Log in to post a reply

Posts.Content: Sep 20, 2007 06:15AM Mamasj wrote: I just had my first normal mam. The first one was abnormal, so I've been diong the happy dance. I have to keep my port for 6 months after treatment, so that means it won't come out until after the first of the year. My hair is 3 1/2" long and still extreemly curly. I hope everyone is doing great!! May God Bless Sue
